parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine cradle mounting bolt can cause the engine to shift and the front control arm to move during operation, leading to a loss of steering and potentially resulting in a crash.
symptoms: Engine shifts and front control arm moves during operation
loss of second right-side mounting support structure.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the cooling system can cause the engine to overheat, leading to engine damage, stalling, and potentially causing an accident.
The malfunction of the belt tensioner can cause the serpentine belt to fail, leading to engine noise, overheating, and potentially causing an accident.
The failure of oxygen and hydrogen sensors can cause the vehicle to surge, leading to a loss of control and potentially causing an accident.
The failure of the PCV valve can cause the vehicle to surge, leading to a loss of control and potentially causing an accident.
The failure of the motor mounts can cause a jerky motion when the car slows down, leading to a loss of control and potentially causing an accident.
symptoms: Jerky motion when car slows down

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The premature wear of the camshaft can cause engine damage, leading to costly repairs and potentially causing an accident.

The failure of the power steering pump can cause a loss of power steering assist, making it difficult to steer the vehicle, especially at low speeds, which can lead to accidents or loss of vehicle control.
symptoms: steering wheel hangs up when making turns
puddle of power steering fluid under the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rack and pinion steering system can cause a loss of vehicle control, making it difficult or impossible to steer the vehicle, which can lead to accidents.
symptoms: pulling to one side while driving
puddle of power steering fluid under the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering column can cause a loss of vehicle control, making it difficult or impossible to steer the vehicle, which can lead to accidents.
The malfunctioning ignition switch can cause the vehicle to start without a key, continue running even when the key is removed, or fail to start altogether, leading to safety risks and inconvenience.
symptoms: vehicle continues to run after key removal
ignition switch fails to rotate to normal position

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electronic computer module can cause the vehicle to stall, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
The failure of electrical components, such as battery cables or wiring harnesses, can cause various systems to malfunction, leading to safety risks and inconvenience.
The failure of motor support mounts can cause engine damage and lead to costly repairs.
symptoms: repeated replacement of motor support mounts.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The electrical fire can cause damage to the vehicle and potentially lead to injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Smoke coming from the dashboard area and under the hood.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Unavailability of Replacement Seat Belt Parts
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The unavailability of replacement seat belt parts can lead to compromised safety in the event of an accident, as drivers may be forced to continue using damaged or worn-out seat belts.
symptoms: Difficulty obtaining replacement seat belt parts
from the manufacturer or local dealerships.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Inadequate seat belt functionality can lead to reduced safety in the event of an accident, as passengers may not be properly restrained.
symptoms: Seat belts do not hold car seats efficiently
